review.title: Building a Classification Model for Enrollment In Higher Educational Courses using Data Mining Techniques
review.abstract: Data Mining is the process of extracting useful patterns from the huge amount of database and many data mining techniques are used for mining these patterns. Recently, one of the remarkable facts in higher educational institute is the rapid growth data and this educational data is expanding quickly without any advantage to the educational management. The main aim of the management is to refine the education standard; therefore by applying the various data mining techniques on this data one can get valuable information. This research study proposed the "classification model for the student's enrollment process in higher educational courses using data mining techniques". Additionally, this study contributes to finding some patterns that are meaningful to management.

metadata.title: Building a Classification Model for Enrollment In Higher Educational Courses using Data Mining Techniques

sections.text: It is only a matter of time before it happens, until it happens.

sections.heading: History of Data Mining
sections.text: Data mining was introduced in the 1990s. Data mining is rooted in three family lines: statistics, artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning. Statistics is based on many technologies such as regression analysis, standard distribution, standard variance, standard deviation, cluster analysis and differentiated analyses. Data mining builds on these technologies and these technologies are also useful to study data and data relationships. Data mining classification algorithms use statistical methods to create decision trees and rules to validate machine learning based models. Artificial intelligence is based on heuristics and is used to apply human thought processing to statistical issues. Data mining incorporates ideas from artificial intelligence and pattern recognition such as signal processing or visualization techniques. Machine learning is a combination of statistics and artificial intelligence because it mixes artificial intelligence with advanced statistical analysis.Figure 1.1 shows intersections of data mining with various related technologies.

sections.heading: Data Mining Definition
sections.text: A knowledge finding process in databases consists of the following steps: StatisticArtificial Intelligence, Pattern Recognition Data Mining Understanding the Requirements Selection of a Target Data Set Data Cleaning and Pre-Processing Integration of the Data Set Modeling Select Data Mining Algorithms Evaluation of the results Testing the results Using this found knowledge

sections.heading: Working of Data mining
sections.text: Data mining is the process of analyzing and aggregating data into useful information. Data mining software is an analytical tool that allows the data to be analyzed, categorized and aggregated. Data mining process includes five elements that can be aggregated: extraction, transformation and loading of transaction data into the data warehouse system. Storing and managing the data in a database system (multi-dimensional). Providing data access for business analysts and professionals. Analyzing the data (through application software) Display the data in a graph or table.

sections.heading: Data Mining Techniques
sections.text: Classification: Classification is the best & most popular approach. Classification is the process of searching for a set of models or functions that describe and differentiate data classes or concepts, with the aim of being able to predict from the model the class of objects whose class name is unknown. Unlike a classification model, the purpose of the predictive model is to determine the future outcome and not the current behavior. Its output can be categorical or numerical value. It is a supervised learning, as the classes are determined before the data is examined. Clustering: Clustering is best suited to find groups of similar data elements. Clustering divides a group of data elements into classes, so that similar characteristic elements are grouped together. Association analysis: It is used to discover relationships between attributes and elements, as the presence of one pattern implies the presence of another pattern. Association rule is a popular technique for market banner groups, unable to combine all possible product combinations.

sections.heading: Data Mining Advantages
sections.text: Data Mining is so sought after because of its many advantages. We have many cheaper techniques to collect and manage the data, but there are only a few techniques to extract useful knowledge from this data. Data Mining has several advantages in many areas. Marketing and Retail: Marketers can take action to meet customer needs and change their buying behavior using Data Mining.Banking: Financial institutions can get help with data mining for credit and credit information. A credit card issuer can detect fraudulent credit card transactions. Researchers: Using data mining techniques, researchers extract useful knowledge by analyzing their data and preceding their researches.Education: Data MiningTo Design, Plan To Use, communicateAcademicians StudentsTo show discovered knowledgeTo show RecommendationsCourse information, Academic Data Mining in Education1.2 Need of Current Research Educational Systems Data MiningTo design to use.

sections.heading: Educational Data Mining
sections.text: Educational Data Mining (EDM) combines data mining and knowledge-gathering methods in an educational environment. EDM examines line data from the educational environment into useful data that can be used to make decisions and solve problems.

sections.heading: A. Data Mining Techniques in Educational Systems
sections.text: In education systems, data mining techniques can find useful patterns, and these useful patterns can be used for many purposes.

sections.heading: Predicting Student Performance:
sections.text: In education systems, using data mining techniques, student performance is predicted and these values can be numerical or categorical. Regression analysis finds a correlation between a dependent (numerical) and one or more independent variables (numerical). Classification techniques are used to classify individual items. Various data mining techniques such as neural network, rules-based system, regression analysis, correlation analysis are applied to educational data.

sections.heading: Grouping Students:
sections.text: Cluster and classification techniques are used to build student groups based on their characteristics, performance, etc. Different cluster algorithms are kmean, hierarchical, model-based clustering.

sections.heading: Enrollment Management:
sections.text: Enrollment management is required in the education system in order to shape an institution's enrollment strategy and meet all objectives. It involves a range of activities such as marketing, retention program and admissions procedures. 1.3 Research Objective The objective of this work can be divided as follows: Concept: Understand the concept of data analysis and how these methods can be applied to educational data such as classification analysis. Method: After initial research, choose a classification method for data mining. Evaluate: Find a method that is capable of correctly classifying a data set of a student with a success rate of at least 70%. For this requirement, the Decision Tree method is used here to develop a classification model that provides a model accuracy of 69.69%. 1.4 Research Contribution This project aims to develop a classification model for enrollment programs using data mining techniques. This model helps us to predict these objectives: We can identify academic achievements for specific student enrollment weeks by providing a classification analysis of student benefits.

sections.heading: SPSS
sections.text: The results of this study have been in development for more than thirty years. | Originally conceived as a programming language for performing statistical analysis, it has been incorporated into a complex and powerful application with a graphical and syntactical interface and offers dozens of functions for managing, analyzing and presenting data. SPSS Inc. continues its tradition of regularly improving this family of powerful but easy-to-use statistical software products with the release of SPSS 16.0. In this study, it is used to perform correlation between the attributes and the final grade (PG Grade).3.1.3 Flowchart of process Step 1: Data Collection Step 1: Data Collection Step 2: Data Collection Step 2: Data Preprocessing, transformation, normalization) Step 3: Use the Data Mining WEKA tool Step 4: Apply the ID3 decision tree classification technique on data Step 5: Evaluate the Results Step 6: Perform classification on new data Step 7: 1.4 Evaluate the decision-making results of Step 7.

referenceMentions.context: The educational data mining is a recent and popular area, there are many journals, ongoing books, workshops [1].
Delavari and Beikzadeh [2] give knowledge to use data mining methods in Higher learning institutions and define how data mining can be applied to the educational data.

Bichkar [3] define that a model can be created using student’s past-academic performance with the help of decision tree algorithm and this model can predict student’s performance in the first year of engineering exam.
Kovacic [5] show a case study for student’s success prediction using educational data mining.

[6] predict the performance of undergraduate and postgraduate students at two different institutes using decision tree and Bayesian network and this is used to find and helping failing students and determines scholarship.
Hijazi and Naqvi [7] show a case study on student performance.
Prasanna Venkatesan [8] conduct a case study on student’s qualitative data using decision tree algorithms to identify the effect of qualitative data in the performance of the student.
El-Halees [9] conduct a case study on graduate students’ data using data mining techniques to improve performance and extract useful knowledge from this data.
lobo [10] conduct a comparative study to predict course selection using association rule algorithms.
Senthil Kumar [13] use a classification method that helps to improve the performance & extract the knowledge from student’s final semester marks.
Varun Kumar and Anupama Chadha [14] used association rule technique to improve the performance of postgraduate students.
Abeer Badr El Din Ahmed and Ibrahim Sayed Elaraby [15] use decision tree technique for data classification that is helpful for predicting the student’s final grade.
R Quinlan summarizes an approach and describes ID3 and this was the first research work on ID3 algorithm [16].
In the decision tree a property on the basis of calculation is selected as the root of the tree and this process’s steps are repeated [19].
She checks the network anomalies from the decision tree then she discovers the comparative analysis of different clustering algorithms and existing id3 decision tree [20].

Yadav, Bharadwaj and Pal [21] obtained the students data such as attendance, seminar, assignment marks and class test to predict the end semester performance using three algorithms ID3decision tree, C4.
15 Pandey and Pal [22] show their study using association rule analysis to find the student interest of choosing class language.

Bharadwaj and Pal [23] use the classification decision tree technique to evaluate student’ end semester performance, this study helps to identify the dropouts and students who require special attention and teacher advising.
et al [24] presents a classification based model for student performance prediction using ID3 algorithm,C4.
kumar [25] use a classification approach that extracts the knowledge from student end semester marks.
Han and Kamber [27] describes data mining software that allow the users to analyze data from different views, and summarize these relationships which are identified during the mining process.

Inayat Khan [29] applied K-mean clustering to analyze learning behavior of students which will help the tutor to improve the performance of students and reduce the dropout ratio to a significant level.
D’Mello [30] studied on bored and frustrated student.
